Class DateFunctions

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.vernalis.knime.internal.flowcontrol.nodes.timedloops.abstrct.DateFunctions

extends java.lang.Object
    Utility functions for handling date comparisons and generating end dates.
    Author:
    Stephen Roughley

      • isNowAfter

        public static boolean isNowAfter(java.util.Date endTime)
        Checks whether the current date/time is after a specified date/time.
        Parameters:
        endTime - The specified end time/date
        Returns:
        true if now is after endTime

      • getEndTime

        public static java.util.Date getEndTime(int hour,
                        int min,
                        boolean runTillTomorrow,
                        boolean runTillMonday)
        Creates an end time, based on an hour and minute. OPtions allow for running until that time on the following day if it has already passed on the current day, and for running until the following Monday if the resulting time is on a Saturday or Sunday.
        Parameters:
        hour - The hour (0 - 23)
        min - The minute (0 - 59)
        runTillTomorrow - If set, then the time will have 1 day added if the specified time is already in the past
        runTillMonday - If set, then the time will be changed to the following Monday if it is on a Saturday or Sunday (taking account of the runTillTomorrow setting, which is applied first)
        Returns:
        A Date representing the required end time

      • getEndTime

        public static java.util.Date getEndTime(int day,
                        int hour,
                        int min,
                        int sec)
        Creates an end time/date based on an elapsing time interval from the current time/date.
        Parameters:
        day - The number of days to add
        hour - The number of hours to add
        min - The number of minutes to add
        sec - The number of seconds to add
        Returns:
        A Date representing the required end time
